pros: Willing to work with scheduling Unlimited hours

pros: 20 bucks is 20 bucks

pros: Pay is decent and hours unlimited

pros: Rewarding, exciting felling of helping people all the time

review_title: Get ridden worse than a low rate porn star.
pros: I get thanked for my services and sometimes get gas cards.
cons: Terribly understaffed. Hope you like running non-stop, balls to the wall for little pay. The whole county will sometimes have less than a handful ( A LOT less) trucks at any given time. People will die due to MMR not retaining staff and working the staff they have so far into the ground the workers themselves will be pushing daisies soon. From the moment you clock in (heck sometimes even before you have your truck checked in) they will bend you over, rip your pants off and penetrate you for however long your shift is without a lubricant and expect you to take it with a smile. And let’s also address dispatch—- they’re a joke and sit in their nice glass boxes untouchable with no worries at level 0 coverage. A nut less monkey could do a better job then some of the dispatchers.

pros: Great experience being a pre-hospital 911 provider. Very high call volume with a diverse population. Great to learn and grow as an EMS provider.
cons: One of the busiest calls per 12-hour shifts in the state. Under staffed.

pros: Helping to save people’s lives.
cons:
Bad management whose homophobic.
One of if not the lowest pay for this type of position. Start off at 13 an hour.

review_title: Hey, let us have a pizza party?!? Instead of actually fixing our problems.
pros:
+ friendly and caring road staff co-workers. 

+ proper and well maintained equipment.

+ regular weekend pizza parties for the three to four weekend Saginaw city crews!
cons:
- Subpar pay scale in comparison to other private EMS agencies. 

- lackluster healthcare benefits. 

- poor staffing.

- heavy work load in comparison to pay rate and other EMS agencies. 

- rarely out on time as management prioritizes interfaculty transfers over E-calls and available resources. 

- attempts to bribe employees into writing positive reviews on Glassdoor and Indeed.

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Coleman, MI
pros: Great work place and great co workers
cons: Can be very stressful at times

pros: Free education, free uniforms, free food (only to boose morale), decent benefits.
cons: Routinely neglects 911 coverage for local and long distance transfers, upper management does not communicate with lower management and road staff, neglects contract requirements, threatens defamation and slander lawsuits when surrounding agencies attempt to them accountable. Pay is below cost of living and pay scale is slow moving. Surrounding municipal agencies pay far better for the work required.

review_title: Decent agency to get your feet wet with but it has it’s problems.
pros:
Free EMS education if you employed and tuition reimbursement for those seeking a degrees outside the company. So the company is great for those looking to further their career in EMS or elsewhere.

Never a shortage of overtime.. for better or worse.

The equipment, stretchers, monitors, trucks, etc are well maintained.
 
A yearly pay increases in July and the potential for a late fall bonus in November although this isn’t guaranteed.

Paid time off.

If you want experience in EMS, there is a Very high call volume in Saginaw county.
cons:
Very short staffed. Especially in Saginaw county. Not uncommon to get out late for emergency calls or transfers.

Never a shortage of overtime.. for better or worse.

The Very high call volume in Saginaw county I mentioned doesn’t equate to great pay. 

The paramedic education program, while offered free via work contract, is lackluster. Educators don’t so much lecture and well education as much as they direct you through an online based program. Many hours of slide shows and praying you get placed with a medic preceptor that’s willing to and knowledgeable enough to teach. 

Pay is substandard in comparison to other agencies by a large margin. Entry level EMT BASIC pay is $11 starting where as PARAMEDIC pay starts at $16. Currently Saginaw county also offers a $0.50 hourly bonus for EMT Basic and $1.50 hourly bonus for Paramedics. Even with these bonuses, pay is below other regional private services. 

Upper Management does not communicate well with middle management which doesn’t communicate with supervision which doesn’t communicate with road staff. Even during a pandemic direction from the top was nonexistent.

pros: Decent Pay and benefits but they cost and co-pays and deductibles are ridiculous
cons: Long hours, stressful , huge burn out rate especially since COVID

review_title: Great Company compared to other surrounding EMS Companies
pros:
Free Education
Great Benefits
Mangers and Supervisors engaged with staff
Fair Pay
Company has reachable goals for the future
Good Equipment 
Power cots with Power load (back savers)
401K with 3% match
Caring road staff top notch patient care
PTO
Proactive to customer demand
Fiscally responsible
cons: Short staffed like every other EMS agency (National Shortage of Paramedics)

pros: Willing to work around family schedules. Genesee county operations manager is understanding and always willing to work with you.
cons: As any EMS job the pay is not ideal. But better than most in the area.

pros: Great company, schedule and pay. Lots of education in house and tuition assistance available. If you want to work for a consistent organization and build a career this is the place. Come see for yourself!
cons: Nothing negative on my end.

pros: Lots of calls and get out late
cons: Lots of experience and good variety of calls

pros: Great company to work for, job is fun and so much room to grow
cons: Pay isn’t the best, but they do try to work on that

pros: Good benefits. Help others, when there's an ambulance available to do so at least since they are so short staffed
cons: Everything else. This is why they can not retain employees.

pros: Fun job if that is the kind of work you are looking for. Equipment is a little above industry standard, which is nice. Road supervisors are very hit or miss. Some play favorites and are incredibly lazy, while others will bend over backward to help you out.
cons: Very difficult to ever get time off. You are heavily penalized for missing shifts. Also, lots of idiots work there, so it's nerve-wracking to never know if your partner for the day is going to be incompetent. Prepare to work long hours for little pay, and have no guarantee of getting out on time. Strict tattoo policy as well. Also, two supervisors had a threesome with  a basically braindead potential employee, and she magically got hired, with no repercussions from management to the supervisors (even though they were well aware). So if you're having trouble getting hired, you know what to do....

pros: Equipment works, job pays the bills
cons: Extremely lazy coworkers. You can never get time off you need. Horrible scheduling,  you can work 9a-9p one day and have to be back again at 5:30a the next day. Pay is a joke, supervisors are hit or miss, most of them are a miss though. No room for advancement. PCR software is the absolute worst I have ever used and 80% of the time you are staying late to do paperwork.

review_title: A workplace to be around of
pros: It is a great way to get experience in the field, you will learn more than you ever imagined, co-workers are great and supportive
cons: The pay isn't great, you have to love what you do, some shifts can be long and hard, but in the end worth it.

pros: Decent benefits, lots of available overtime
cons: Overworked, walked on by management, treated as insignificant and disposable, horrible communication. High turnover, can not keep employees

pros: Great schedule flexibility, supervisors are great, love working here.
cons: Other divisions use Genesee County as it's whipping boy

cons: Low wages and uninterested managers.
